BackLVXGripShrugPL.name: Lever Gripless Shrug (plate loaded)
BackLVXGripShrugPL.preparation: Stand with shoulders under padded lever.
BackLVXGripShrugPL.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
BackLVXGripShrugPL.comments: If possible, position lever height high enough so weight will not need to be squat up that high, but not so high that weight stack bottoms out during exercise. Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria.

BackLVSeatedShrug.name: Lever Seated Shrug (plate loaded)
BackLVSeatedShrug.preparation: Sit on bench and grasp lower handles to each side. Sit upright.
BackLVSeatedShrug.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
BackLVSeatedShrug.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria.

BackLVShrugH.name: Lever Shrug (plate loaded)
BackLVShrugH.preparation: Stand between lever handles to sides. Squat down with feet flat on floor and grasp upper handles to sides. Stand upright by extending hips and knees to full extension.
BackLVShrugH.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
BackLVShrugH.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors. Also see exercise performed on alternative machines Alternative machine 1Alternative machine 2 Classification UtilityBasicMechanicsIsolatedForcePull

BackLVBBShrug.name: Lever Barbell Shrug (plate loaded)
BackLVBBShrug.preparation: Stand behind bar midthigh height. Stand grasping bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back and stand upright.
BackLVBBShrug.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
BackLVBBShrug.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

BackLVShrugNarrowH.name: Lever Narrow Grip Shrug (plate loaded)
BackLVShrugNarrowH.preparation: Stand very near to close lever handles. Bend over and grasp handles with each hand. Stand upright.
BackLVShrugNarrowH.execution: Elevate shoulders as high as possible. Lower and repeat.
BackLVShrugNarrowH.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria.
